thread.title: 19 Crazy Little Things In "The Princess Diaries" You Never Noticed Before
thread.title_full: 19 Crazy Little Things In "The Princess Diaries" You Never Noticed Before

author: Sam Stryker
title: 19 Crazy Little Things In "The Princess Diaries" You Never Noticed Before
text:
View this image › 
Disney So Anne Hathaway and company were in good hands.
ID: 10709589 2. Mia’s high school mascot, which is fitting considering the lion is the king of the jungle… View this image › 
Disney ID: 10709141 3. …and in a fitting nod, the Genovian consulate features lion statues guarding the entrance. View this image › 
Disney It all makes sense.
ID: 10709402 4. At the beginning of the movie, Mia is tasked with defending the school dress code in debate class. This is a clever bit of ironic foreshadowing, because she goes from wanting to blend in to standing out as a teenage princess. View this image › 
Disney Oh, how things change!
ID: 10708972 5. OK, doesn’t it seem a little odd that Mia knows WHERE her grandma lives AND her name, yet can’t piece together she’s royalty? View this image › 
Disney It just doesn’t make sense!
ID: 10708992 6. The Genovian crest kind of looks like Gryffindor’s with its matching color scheme and gold “G.” View this image › 
Disney Not to mention the LIONS previously mentioned!
ID: 10709181 7. On a not-so-nice note, somehow an eating disorder joke made it into a Disney movie. What?! Disney
Disney
  C’mon.
ID: 10709251 8. And did this drag queen joke just go over our heads at the time? Disney
Disney
  Oh, Joe.
ID: 10709326 9. Michael plays music with M&Ms on the keys, which seems both impractical and unsanitary. View this image › 
Disney Kind of gross, TBH.
ID: 10709264 10. Paolo pulls a hair dryer and straightener out of his pants pockets, which seems both unsafe and uncomfortable. View this image › 
Disney Who has pants pockets that are THAT big?
ID: 10709424 11. Good thing reporters discovered royalty was hiding in plain sight, because otherwise it would have been a slow news day — other top stories are a trend piece on red hair and “The Science of Sneezing.” View this image › 
Disney Neither scream “front page.”
ID: 10709530 12. Paolo’s last name is Puttanesca, which is fitting. The pasta dish of the same name is called that because it was a favorite of prostitutes, or it has a lot of “shit” thrown in — and Paolo sold out Mia. View this image › 
Disney Clever!
ID: 10709547 13. Can we just appreciate Queen Clarisse’s face in what we can assume is her first-ever snap in a photobooth? View this image › 
Disney It’s perfect.
ID: 10709619 14. Does this photographer looking to get Mia’s picture think he is fooling ANYONE with his grass “camouflage” he has around his camera? View this image › 
Disney You’re not blending in at all, pal.
ID: 10709733 15. Mia doesn’t just cone Lana — she gets IN THERE, spreading the ice cream all over her chest. View this image › 
Disney “Lana got coned!”
ID: 10709795 16. Willie Brown actually WAS mayor of San Francisco! View this image › 
Disney Were we supposed to notice that cameo as kids?
ID: 10709832 17. This plot hole never was resolved: Who put the M&Ms on the pizza for Michael? Mia never had time to go to the pizzeria, so did she have it delivered to her, placed the candy, then relayed it over? Or did she just expect the pizzeria to have chocolate lying around? View this image › 
Disney We demand answers!
ID: 10709856 18. The Genovian motto is “Totus Corpus Laborat”, which means “the whole body works.” That being said, it’s technically incorrect — it should be “Totum.” View this image › 
Disney Latin is tricky.
ID: 10709872 19. Finally, the jewels on Mia’s crown are absolutely appropriate — they kind of look like pears, the fruit Genovia is best-known for. View this image › 
Disney A truly magical detail.
ID: 10709922 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com! 
  More News About Anne Hathaway
